Hey **Essemble**,

As a friendly reminder you are not aloud to "name and shame" on the boards. We know that players report publicly with the best intentions, but it often leads to a witch-hunt, rarely resulting in a positive discussion. If you want to post something like this, make sure to blur the names out of the image or some other editing technique. Naming and shaming again will land you a temporary ban on the boards.
But in this case he didn't "name and shame" anyone. He just posted an in-game picture. So there is no witch hunt happening.

> [{quoted}](name=Cakemeisting,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=m4iZqEuJ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-23T21:26:55.437+0000)
>
> But in this case he didn't "name and shame" anyone. He just posted an in-game picture. So there is no witch hunt happening.

Posting anything which slanders anyones name in any way shape or form is "naming and shaming". In this case here, he screen shotted and posted the photo on boards with the name of the person still on the photo. 

So it would be classified as something similar to or exactly like "naming and shaming" because the person who uploaded the photo didn't blur out the name of the person being extremely toxic, which then gives that person a bad name.

You might not call it "naming and shaming" either, you might just call it "reporting someone on the forums" or something. But I hope you know what I mean.

True, nice legal standpoint there. However, you have to remember there is also "intent".

Let me help you with that one.

_intention_: A person intends a consequence they foresee that it will happen if the given series of acts or omissions continue, and desires it to happen

Now if your intention is for people to think "omg what a douche" and THEN that leads into witchhunts, then your intention was the same as giving the villagers pitchforks, burning torches, and giving them an address.

If however you and a friend are just playing a joke, and thought it would be funny :), then please specify that you and this guy are friends and that you guys are trolling so people dont get the wrong idea, you know, internet and all that.

See previous comment re: context 

As an aside, and TOTALLY unrelated note. We all have toxic people that we think that more should be happening with, and having no faith in the system leads us to do crazy things, but remember, put the shoe on the other foot and walk a mile in someone elses shoes. How would you feel if someone else posted a pic like that ya know?
